title: Overwatering
desc: One of the most common mistakes is giving your plant too much water. Excess moisture can suffocate roots, promote fungal growth

title: Lack of Sunlight
desc: Plants need light to photosynthesize. Placing them in dark corners deprives them of energy and causes poor growth, yellowing leaves.

title: Poor Drainage
desc: Without proper drainage holes, water accumulates at the bottom, drowning the roots. Always choose pots with drainage.

title: Ignoring Pests
desc: Insects like spider mites and aphids can silently damage your plant. If left untreated, they multiply and affect nearby plants too.

title: Wrong Soil Type
desc: Each plant species has different soil needs. Using garden soil indoors or heavy clay for succulents can stunt growth.

title: Fertilizer Overuse
desc: More isn't always better. Over-fertilizing can burn roots and lead to salt buildup. Stick to the recommended dose and fertilize.
